metadata.title: CVE-2024-38574 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: libbpf:Prevent null-pointer dereference when prog to load has no BTF Inbpf_objec_load_prog(), there's no guarantee that obj->btf is non-NULL whenpassing it to btf__fd(), and this function does not perform any checkbefore dereferencing its argument (as bpf_object__btf_fd() used to do). Asa consequence, we get segmentation fault errors in bpftool (for example)when trying to load programs that come without BTF information. v2: Keepbtf__fd() in the fix instead of reverting to bpf_object__btf_fd().

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
